params.text:
A palindrome_none is a string that has no character match when you flip it. In other words, the first letter MUST NOT equal the last letter, 
        and the second letter MUST NOT equal the second to last letter ... etc.
params.requirement: For the purposes of this problem, all zero-letter and one-letter words are NOT palindrome_none's.
params.example_text: None of the characters of 'peak' matches when reversed, meaning, 'peak' != 'kaep' for any character.

names_for_user.name: all_but_first_of
names_for_user.description: Function to remove the first character of a string

names_for_user.name: all_but_last_of
names_for_user.description: Function to remove the last character of a string

names_from_user.name: is_palindrome_all
names_from_user.description: Function to determine whether a string is a palindrome_All

names_from_user.name: is_palindrome_any
names_from_user.description: Function to determine whether a string is a palindrome_Any

names_from_user.name: is_palindrome_none
names_from_user.description: Function to determine whether a string is a palindrome_None

params.counter_example_text: At least one character of 'peek' matches peek. 'peek' reversed is 'keep', the second and third characters match.
